critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving an agreement related to the construction industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It's heavily focused on economic regulation and intervention, as it directly involves the government in setting standards and agreements within the construction industry. There's no direct impact on immigration, executive power, federalism, national security/civil liberties, or social inclusion. The ideological tilt is towards liberal, given the interventionist approach to the economy, which was a hallmark of Roosevelt's New Deal policies.
